properties.areaDesc: Vermillion, IN; Parke, IN; Vigo, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 18 at 10:10PM EST until January 25 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...Eel River...Mississinewa River...Wabash
River...White River...

.Minor to moderate flooding continued Saturday night in
central and southern Indiana on the major rivers. Crests will be/are
comparable to those that occurred in February and June of 2019. On
the Eel and Mississinewa, minor flooding has developed.

Mixed precipitation yesterday and today has totaled up to about
1.50 inches, which will slow river falls or bring lower secondary
crests on the major rivers, and produce additional minor flooding on
smaller ones. Flooding may recur at Seymour on the East Fork White
River and Spencer on the White River.

Flooding along the lower portions of the White and Wabash Rivers
will continue until the last few days of the month.

Our next precipitation event in the forecast does not arrive until
Friday, thus we will have several dry days to allow for drainage of
area waterways.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Wabash River at Montezuma.
* until Saturday January 25.
* At  9:45 PM Saturday the stage was 20.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 14.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 21.1 feet by late Sunday night then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Saturday January 25.
* At 20.0 feet...Park in southern Montezuma begins to flood.  Higher
bottomlands begin to flood.  Water backs up most local tributaries.
River water is at the top of some private levees.  Lowest county
roads begin to flood.  Parke CR 75 W begins to flood.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
